sentences.en: Bacteria sticks to food debris in the teeth, causing decay.
sentences.cn: 细菌附着在牙缝中的食物残渣上, 导致蛀牙.

sentences.en: Coal of all kinds originated from the decay of plants.
sentences.cn: 各种煤都是由植物的朽烂形成的.

sentences.en: decaying organic matter
sentences.cn: 腐烂的有机物

sentences.en: Her body was already starting to decay.
sentences.cn: 她的尸体已经开始腐烂。

sentences.en: In Orthodox Europe, mass religion seems to have decayed less.
sentences.cn: 在正教会流行的欧洲地区，集体宗教信仰的影响力似乎衰退得没那么严重。

sentences.en: Most archaeological finds are broken, damaged, or decayed.
sentences.cn: 大部分考古发现物都已破裂、损坏或腐烂。

sentences.en: Our powers decay in old age.
sentences.cn: 我们的体力在老年时就衰退.

sentences.en: Some utensils were in a state of decay when they were unearthed.
sentences.cn: 有些器皿在出土时已经残破.

sentences.en: Sugar can decay the teeth.
sentences.cn: 糖能腐蚀牙齿.

sentences.en: The bodies buried in the fine ash slowly decayed.
sentences.cn: 埋在细灰里的尸体慢慢腐烂了。

sentences.en: The corpse was preserved from decay by embalming.
sentences.cn: 尸体用香料涂抹以防腐烂.

sentences.en: The decay of the meat could have been prevented by proper refrigeration.
sentences.cn: 如果经过适当的冷藏,这些肉本来不至于腐烂掉.

sentences.en: The house is in decay.
sentences.cn: 这栋房子已经坏了.

sentences.en: The landlord had let the building fall into decay .
sentences.cn: 房东不管，房子已经破烂不堪。

sentences.en: The old house fell into decay.
sentences.cn: 那幢旧房子腐朽了.

sentences.en: The phosphate was deposited by the decay of marine microorganisms.
sentences.cn: 海洋微生物腐烂后沉积形成磷酸盐。

sentences.en: The timber has started to decay.
sentences.cn: 木材已开始腐烂.

sentences.en: The vegetables have begun to decay.
sentences.cn: 那些蔬菜已开始腐烂.

sentences.en: There are problems of urban decay and gang violence.
sentences.cn: 存在城市衰败和帮派暴力的问题。

sentences.en: tooth decay
sentences.cn: 蛀牙

sentences.en: When not removed, plaque causes tooth decay and gum disease.
sentences.cn: 牙斑如果不清除就会导致牙齿蛀蚀和牙龈疾病。

words.tran_cn: 衰退，[核]衰减；腐烂，[木]腐朽
使腐烂，使腐败；使衰退，使衰落

phrases.tran_cn: 衰变曲线；衰减曲线；退化曲线；余辉曲线
衰减率；衰变率；衰变速度

trans.tran_en: the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of something
to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this
When something such as a dead body, a dead plant, or a tooth decays, it is gradually destroyed by a natural process
to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this
to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this
to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this
